newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -Notionnel strives to crack 130.16 barrier.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -Notionnel strives to crack 130.16 barrier.

text.p: September notionnel futures on MATIF will aim to break key 130.16 resistance on Tuesday to open the way for further acceleration, technical analysts said.
"The recovery we're seeing this week in the notionnel is looking really quite healthy," said Adrian Sells, director of Crane Investment Analysis in London.
"The immediate key is at 130.16. If we can break out of that, we could see further acceleration." Charts show the market hit a high of 130.16 on August 4.
By 0804 GMT, September notionnel futures were up 0.16 at 130.04.
Marc Ostwald, technical analyst at London Bond Broking here, said recent low volatility suggested the contract would be locked in a narrow range.
He saw a band of congestion between 130.20 and 130.30 proving difficult to overcome.

Support-wise Ostwald said 129.70 was the initial prop, the high on August 13. "Then below there, 129.48 comes in, the high on August 6, followed by a big band of congestion between 129.14 and 129.18 -- that should hold the market long term."
Sells said the low so far this session at 129.80 would act as first support.
"If we were to break that down, I wouldn't want to hang around on the long side," he said.
Below there, Sells said the market had built quite a good base off 129.42, the low last Thursday. "So in the medium term, that's the level that's really got to hold," he said.
By 0824 GMT, September Pibor futures were up 0.02 at 96.53.
